plugins.name: Colour Tools
plugins.description:
👩🏻‍🎨 Colour Tools makes it easier for web and mobile software developers to work with colours:

  1. Pick colours and create colour palettes, either using the plugin's colour picker, or from existing colours in your project
  2. Generate shades from any colour, choosing one ad-hoc or from existing styles in your project
  3. Copy code snippets for software development on web and Android, making it easier for you to add colours to CSS (including preprocessors), Android (including XML and Jetpack Compose)

More information here.

accepted.name: Tina Holly
accepted.description:
👩🏻‍💻 Full Stack Web and Mobile Developer

plugins.name: CDS Figma Converter
plugins.description: 此插件旨在帮助设计师和开发者快速高效地将 Figma 中的设计内容无缝迁移到我们的内部系统 CDS（Content Delivery System）。通过简单易用的操作界面，您可以轻松导出设计文件、组件和图层，并确保所有数据在 CDS 中正确存储和管理，从而提高工作流程的效率，减少重复劳动。适用于需要在多平台间协同工作的团队，助力项目的快速迭代和交付。

plugins.name: Padding Check
plugins.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? This plugin solves this problem of yours where you can quickly identify the Figma frames with the said padding issues. The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.

accepted.name: Praveen P Jose
accepted.description: Senior UX Designer @ Walmart

plugins.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

134144.name: Padding Check
134144.description: Are developers always at your back since your paddings are always not multiples of 4? The plugin has a very simple UI where we have info display section and 2 buttons. 1st button "Highlight frames" selects all problematic frames and brings them to your view (Shift+1) and the 2nd button "Mark frames" creates a red box around all the frames that have a padding issue. The good news is that this plugin works only for Auto layout frames and not for all frames thereby not giving you unwanted results. As a helper once the plugin is executed (either of the buttons used to find the frames with issues) The information section of the plugin UI displays the count of the frames with issues helping the user to quickly take account of the issue.
134144.tagline: Are all paddings in your Figma file multiples of 4? Use this plugin to quickly identify if not!

plugins.name: Grids Moodbook
plugins.description:
Effortlessly organize your design elements with Layout Magic – a powerful layout tool that automates arrangement using smart visual principles.


Whether you're designing responsive components, portfolios, or dashboards, Layout Magic helps you arrange selected frames and components into beautiful, functional layouts like:


🧱 Masonry Grid – Neatly stacks elements based on height.


🌟 Golden Ratio – Distributes elements proportionally for aesthetic balance.


🌀 Fibonacci Spiral – Creates a harmonious spiral layout inspired by nature.

plugins.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic
plugins.description:
Instantly flip any text layer—or whole frames—from Latin to Serbian Cyrillic and back.


🛠 How it works

• Select text, groups, frames, or the entire page

• Run Plugins → “Latin ➜ Cyrillic” or “Cyrillic ➜ Latin”

• Fonts auto‑load, characters swap, you’re done


✨ Why it’s handy

• Keeps typographic styles intact (font, size, color)

• Handles digraphs (dž, lj, nj, dj) correctly

• Works inside components, variants, and instances

• Zero setup, zero UI—pure speed


⚠️ Limitations

• Only supports Serbian alphabet (no Russian/Belarusian rules yet)

• Ignores mixed selections locked inside Boolean Ops
plugins.tagline: One‑click Serbian Latin ⇄ Cyrillic transliteration

128574.name: Latin ⇄ Cyrillic

Automatically rename frames left-to-right, top-to-bottom

Perfect for UI designers, developers, and anyone working with structured layouts in Figma.

plugins.name: Private Notes
plugins.description:
Private Notes allows you to attach personal annotations to any layer in your Figma file that remain completely private to you.


  1. Truly Private: Notes are stored locally and their contents are only visible to you, never to other collaborators
  2. Visual Markers: Customisable markers show where you've left notes (only visible when you run the plugin)
  3. Flexible Positioning: Place note markers in 8 different positions around your layers that stay fixed to the right frame.
  4. Persistent Storage: Your notes remain attached to layers even when you close and reopen Figma


Perfect for designers who want to keep track of personal thoughts, reminders, and to-dos without cluttering the file with comments visible to everyone.


Use it for recording client feedback, noting implementation details, or leaving yourself breadcrumbs for areas that need further attention.


Please contact me for any feedback. suggestions or issues!
plugins.tagline: Keep your thoughts private- annotations only you can see.

plugins.name: Frames by Names
plugins.description:
Frames by Names is your new Figma sidekick!


Tired of manually creating and naming frames one by one? Just paste in your list of names, pick your desired frame size and letter case style (or keep it original), and watch as your canvas magically fills with neatly organized frames right where you're looking.


Whether you're brainstorming, organizing, or just having fun with names, this plugin makes design setup quick and playful. Say hello to effortless layouts and goodbye to tedious frame creation—let Frames by Names bring order (and a dash of whimsy) to your Figma workflow!

accepted.name: Pragmatics Studio
accepted.description: We believe that design is most beautiful when it works. We’re here to co-create and empower your team with design and creative problem solving.

plugins.tagline: Paste a list of names, choose the frame size, and watch frames appear in view.

plugins.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
plugins.description:
Objective: Implement functionality where clicking a button creates a red rectangle on the workspace.


Implementation Plan:


Creating the Interface:


Add a button labeled "Create Rectangle."

Prepare a canvas or container where the rectangle will appear.

Styling Elements:


Define styles for the button (e.g., color, shape).

Set default dimensions and properties for the rectangle (e.g., width, height, background color).

Programming Logic:


Write an event handler for the button: on click, create an element with predefined properties (e.g., width, height, color).

Append this element to the container on the page.

Testing the Functionality:


Ensure the red rectangle appears correctly and only when the button is clicked.

Optionally, add features such as slightly offsetting the position of each new rectangle.
plugins.tagline: Rectangle

110619.name: Create Red Rectangle Plugin
110619.description:

Programming Logic:

Testing the Functionality:

plugins.name: JSONify
plugins.description:
Export Text Layers as JSON


JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into structured JSON data.


In JSONify, each Figma layer’s name becomes a key in the exported JSON, and the text content within the layer becomes its corresponding value.


For example, a layer named "title" containing the text "Hello World!" would generate the following JSON entry:

"title": "Hello World! (classic 😉)"


This straightforward mapping keeps your exported JSON organized, clean, and easy to integrate - directly reflecting the structure of your design.


How the Plugin Works


  1. Layer names = Object keys: Each layer name becomes a key in the exported JSON object.
  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix “exclude-” to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

accepted.name: Denise Kolodzey
accepted.description:
👋 Hi! 
I’m, a UX Engineer with a love for thoughtful tools and beautiful details.
I build Figma plugins that make workflows smoother and design more fun.

plugins.tagline: JSONify simplifies your workflow by automatically converting selected text layers into JSON data.

How the Plugin Works

  2. Line breaks = Array items: Text containing line breaks (\n) is split into an array of strings.
  3. Groups = Arrays: Grouped text layers are exported as array items under the group's name.
  4. Prefix “exclude-” to skip: Any layer whose name starts with exclude- will be excluded from the export.


🖤 Open-source & community-driven! Check out the code or contribute: https://github.com/ko-ko-lo/figma-json-export


💬 Feedback, ideas, or just want to say hi? Drop a comment - I’d love to hear from you!

plugins.name: Move Outside
plugins.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
plugins.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

106901.name: Move Outside
106901.description:
A plugin designed to move any elements outside of their current frames and place them at the top of the hierarchy while retaining their original position relative to the entire page. The plugin offers two modes:


  1. Default - Moves selected single or multiple elements to the top of the page’s layer hierarchy.
  2. Locked Target - Moves selected single or multiple elements into another specified layer. The Locked Target mode supports moving into frames, frames with autolayout, and sections. If the Locked Target is an autolayout frame, users can choose whether the moved frames should retain their original page position using absolute positioning or adapt to the autolayout.


This plugin stands out from others with similar functionality by offering a full interface that enables continuous management of complex layer structures.
106901.tagline: A plugin used to move elements to the top of the layer hierarchy or to other frames/sections.

plugins.name: UX Buddy - AI powered pair designer
plugins.description:
UX Buddy is your AI-powered design partner, built to streamline your UX workflow and enhance your design process within Figma.


  1. Uncover Assumptions: Identify and challenge underlying assumptions in your designs.
  2. Discover Edge Cases: Proactively find potential error states and unusual user interactions.
  3. Evaluate Usability: Get AI-driven feedback on the usability of your selected layers based on established heuristics.
  4. Check Accessibility: Perform quick accessibility checks, considering WCAG guidelines for aspects like color contrast and more.
  5. Contextual Analysis: Provide persona details, research insights, and other context to get more tailored feedback from your AI Buddy.
  6. Flexible AI Providers: Connect to various AI services including OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face, or your local Ollama instance.
  7. Customizable Prompts: Tailor UX Buddy to your specific needs by creating and managing your own prompt library.


Whether you're brainstorming, refining user flows, or conducting detailed evaluations, UX Buddy acts as an intelligent assistant, helping you make more informed design decisions and create better user experiences, faster.


--------

How to set up AI Provider:


☁️ Option 1: Cloud APIs (OpenAI, GroqCloud, Hugging Face)


Use cloud-based AI models by connecting to one of these supported services.

  1. Select “Cloud API”.
  2. Choose your service (OpenAI, GroqCloud, or Hugging Face) from the dropdown.
  3. Enter your credentials:
  4. OpenAI: API Key from platform.openai.com
  5. ⚠️ Important: OpenAI requires a funded account to use the API. Free trial credits may be available, but ongoing usage requires a billing setup.
  6. GroqCloud: API Key from console.groq.com
  7. Hugging Face: Access Token from huggingface.co/settings/tokens
  8. Enter the Model Name : choose a vision-capable model:
  9. OpenAI: e.g., gpt-4o, gpt-4-vision-preview
  10. GroqCloud: e.g., meta-llama/llama-4-scout-17b-16e-instruct
  11. Hugging Face: e.g., google/gemma-3-27b-it
  12. Click “Test Current AI Connection” to verify everything works.


-----

💻 Option 2: Ollama (Local AI)


Use Ollama to run models locally on your machine—no internet required once models are downloaded.


🔧 Prerequisites:

  1. Install Ollama: Download it from ollama.com.
  2. Run Ollama:
  3. Launch Ollama via terminal (ollama serve) or the desktop app.
  4. For convenience, you can set it up to run in the background automatically:
  5. macOS: via a plist launch agent
  6. Linux: via a systemd service (Note: These are part of your system configuration and not managed by UX Buddy.)
  7. Download Your Model:
  8. Use ollama pull llava or another vision-enabled model.
  9. Ensure the model supports your desired functionality (e.g., image analysis).


🛠️ Configuration in UX Buddy:

  1. Select “Ollama” as your provider.
  2. Enter your API Base URL — usually http://localhost:11434.
  3. Enter the Model Name (e.g., llava, llama3, etc.).
  4. Click “Test Current AI Connection”.
plugins.tagline: Your AI-powered UX design partner.

With instant access to the full Eva Icons library — fully free and open-source — you can seamlessly search, preview, and insert icons right into your projects with just a click. 🚀


No need to leave Figma or waste time downloading SVGs manually. This plugin helps you stay in your creative flow while keeping your UI sharp, modern, and on-brand. 🌟 Whether you're designing dashboards, mobile apps, or websites, Eva Icons deliver clarity and elegance in every pixel. ✅

Tired of manually selecting variant properties one by one?


Variant Multi-Selector solves this by allowing you to multi-select multiple properties and values together — and instantly filter, edit, and manage matching variants inside your component set! 🚀

•Select multiple properties (like Size, State, Type) at once

•Apply filters and select matching variants instantly

•View bound variables attached to your variants (Figma Variables integration!)

•Designed for fast, large-scale Design System workflows


🔥 Perfect for:

•Design system builders

•Product designers managing large variant sets

•UI/UX designers who want to speed up Figma workflows


🙏 Built with love and real-world design pain.

plugins.name: SVG Export no Fill

Ideal for developers who need reusable, customizable icons that can be easily adapted in various projects.

plugins.name: Syntax Manager
plugins.description:
Syntax Manager helps you efficiently organize and apply code syntax (Web, Android, iOS) to your Figma variables. Whether you're prepping for development or just keeping things tidy, it streamlines your syntax workflow.


Core Features

  1. Filter variables by syntax status: all, with syntax, or without
  2. Narrow results by variable library or specific folder
  3. Search by variable name or syntax label
  4. Clean table view displaying variable names and their assigned syntax (Web, Android, iOS)
  5. Inline syntax editing: click directly on the syntax to edit it on the spot
  6. Multiselect with quick Select/Deselect All
  7. Floating action bar to apply updates or remove syntax for selected or all variables
  8. Custom syntax input field with {value} dynamic placeholder support
  9. Prefix dropdown (Auto / Name / Syntax) to control how the template is applied
  10. Advanced find/replace patterns using > and multiple replacements separated by ; for flexible syntax modification


Key Benefits

  1. Saves time: Batch-edit syntax across multiple variables in seconds
  2. Reduces errors: See all syntax at a glance and avoid inconsistencies
  3. Flexible control: Customize syntax naming conventions with smart placeholders
  4. Streamlines handoff: Align design tokens with dev-ready syntax for every platform
  5. Scales effortlessly: Perfect for small projects or massive variable libraries


How to Use

  1. Choose your view: filter by syntax presence or focus on specific libraries/folders
  2. Search or scroll to find relevant variables
  3. Select variables manually or use Select All
  4. Click directly on any syntax cell to edit it inline, or use the footer bar to add, update, or remove syntax
  5. Enter a custom syntax name (or leave it blank to use the variable name) or use find>replace patterns or ; for multiple replacements to transform parts of variable names (for instructions click the (?) icon)
  6. Apply your changes – done!

accepted.name: Sascha Wohlgemuth
accepted.description: UX Designer @ Hoffmann Group

plugins.tagline: Syntax management for variables made effortless.

plugins.name: Translate Text with Gemini
plugins.description:
Translate Text with Gemini is a powerful yet lightweight Figma plugin that helps you quickly translate any selected text nodes into over 30 languages using Google’s Gemini AI.


✨ Key Features:

•Supports App Store Connect languages (e.g. French, Japanese, Arabic, Vietnamese, etc.)

•Smart deduplication — identical phrases are only translated once

•Structured output parsing to ensure accurate mapping

•Custom language support beyond the dropdown list

•Built for speed and scale (bulk translate entire Frames/Sections)


🔒 Your API key is safely stored per session.


Created with ❤️ by Giang Nguyen.
plugins.tagline: Effortless multilingual translation for your Figma designs.

plugins.name: Duplication
plugins.description:
Figma Duplication Plugin

What It Does

The Figma Duplication Plugin is designed to create multiple copies of a selected frame, automatically populating text fields with data from a CSV file. Key features include:


  1. Bulk Duplication: Create multiple copies of a selected frame
  2. Dynamic Text Replacement: Update text content in each duplicate using CSV data
  3. Organized Layout: Automatically arrange duplicates in a grid layout within a new section

How To Use It

  1. Select a Frame: First, select the frame you want to duplicate in your Figma file.


  1. Launch the Plugin: Open the Duplication Plugin from your plugins panel.


Configure Settings:

  1. Enter the number of copies you want to create
  2. Select which text layers you want to modify (you can add multiple)
  3. Upload a CSV file containing the data for text replacement

CSV Format Requirements:


  1. The CSV headers must exactly match the names of the text layers you want to modify
  2. Each row represents data for one duplicate
  3. The plugin will read values from the columns corresponding to your selected text layers
  4. Click Submit: The plugin will create your duplicates in a new section with all text fields updated according to your CSV data.


Limitations

  1. Works only with frames containing text layers
  2. CSV headers must exactly match the text layer names


This plugin is ideal for creating multiple versions of components that differ only in text content, such as cards, buttons, or profile items with different data
plugins.tagline: Tired of filling in your data? just use this ! :D

127056.name: Duplication
127056.description:
Figma Duplication Plugin

What It Does

The Figma Duplication Plugin is designed to create multiple copies of a selected frame, automatically populating text fields with data from a CSV file. Key features include:


  1. Bulk Duplication: Create multiple copies of a selected frame
  2. Dynamic Text Replacement: Update text content in each duplicate using CSV data
  3. Organized Layout: Automatically arrange duplicates in a grid layout within a new section

How To Use It

  1. Select a Frame: First, select the frame you want to duplicate in your Figma file.


  1. Launch the Plugin: Open the Duplication Plugin from your plugins panel.


Configure Settings:

  1. Enter the number of copies you want to create
  2. Select which text layers you want to modify (you can add multiple)
  3. Upload a CSV file containing the data for text replacement

CSV Format Requirements:


  1. The CSV headers must exactly match the names of the text layers you want to modify
  2. Each row represents data for one duplicate
  3. The plugin will read values from the columns corresponding to your selected text layers
  4. Click Submit: The plugin will create your duplicates in a new section with all text fields updated according to your CSV data.


Limitations

  1. Works only with frames containing text layers
  2. CSV headers must exactly match the text layer names


This plugin is ideal for creating multiple versions of components that differ only in text content, such as cards, buttons, or profile items with different data
127056.tagline: Tired of filling in your data? just use this ! :D

plugins.name: Hot Spot
plugins.description:
“Hot Spot” is a Figma plugin that recognizes objects and human faces within image nodes to enable smart image cropping.

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.



//



“Hot Spot”は画像ノードに含まれるオブジェクトや顔（人間）を検出しスマートな画像切り抜きを実現するFigmaプラグインです。

検出処理はTensorFlowの機械学習モデルを利用し、WorkerとWASM (WebAssembly) のパワーで高速に行われます。


***** このプラグインは1回払いの有料プラグインで、10回までのトライアルが可能です。 *****


👉 詳しくは Hot Spot ウェブサイト をご覧ください。

🔑 ライセンスキーは Gumroad でご購入いただけます。
plugins.tagline: Smart Image Cropping Tool powered by Object & Face Detection

128608.name: Hot Spot
128608.description:
“Hot Spot” is a Figma plugin that recognizes objects and human faces within image nodes to enable smart image cropping.

The detection process uses TensorFlow machine learning models and is fast with the power of Worker and WASM (WebAssembly).


***** This plugin is a one-time paid plugin, with up to 10 times trial available. *****


👉 Check out the details on Hot Spot Website.

🔑 You can buy a License Key on Gumroad.



//



“Hot Spot”は画像ノードに含まれるオブジェクトや顔（人間）を検出しスマートな画像切り抜きを実現するFigmaプラグインです。

検出処理はTensorFlowの機械学習モデルを利用し、WorkerとWASM (WebAssembly) のパワーで高速に行われます。


***** このプラグインは1回払いの有料プラグインで、10回までのトライアルが可能です。 *****


👉 詳しくは Hot Spot ウェブサイト をご覧ください。

🔑 ライセンスキーは Gumroad でご購入いただけます。
128608.release_notes:
Fixed a bug in the masking process for image nodes placed in frames and components.
フレームやコンポーネント内に配置された画像ノードのマスク処理の不具合を修正しました。
128608.tagline: Smart Image Cropping Tool powered by Object & Face Detection

plugins.name: Architonic Studio
plugins.description:
Seamlessly integrate your favourite design tools with Architonic! Create and sync boards directly from Figma — bringing your Architonic Studio projects to life in one place.


Features

  1. Use Architonic product database in Figma
  2. Save from Figma to your Favourites and Projects
  3. Download images directly from Figma


Use the most incredible database for Architects and Designers from Figma
plugins.tagline: Seamlessly integrate Figma designs with Architonic!

plugins.name: Asset Dependencies
plugins.description:
Effortlessly manage and visualize your Figma assets with the Asset Dependencies plugin. This powerful tool scans and analyzes your local Figma files, creating a topologically sorted list of all components, subcomponents, dependencies, and usage.


Comprehensive analysis

Automatically scans your Figma assets to identify all components and their relationships.


Topological sorting

Generates a clear, topologically sorted list of components and subcomponents, making it easy to understand dependencies.


Dependency mapping

Visualize which components are used by others, helping you manage and optimize your design system.


Usage insights

See at a glance how and where each component is used across your file.


Export options

Export lists as CSV files to use in other tools.

accepted.name: Elgato
accepted.description: Stream. Record. Create. | Empowering content creators since 2012

accepted.name: Will Johnson
accepted.description: Product Designer at Elgato

plugins.tagline: Get a list of dependencies for your local assets
